answers.answer: Hello.A pinched nerve will rarely cause tingling in arms and face and that too, bilaterally. There must be some other causes that you have to consider. I would also like to know since how many days you are having this.Do you have a history of any back problems ?Other causes might include diabetes, low blood pressure or substance withdrawal. Do you have any of these ?Regards

i was tested for diabetes blood sugar was good also my blood pressure is good too imgoing thru a nicotine withdrawal. my back is fine it hurts oncein a while. ever since i stopped smoking 5 weeks ago ive been getting lightheaded lil dizzy  went  for a mri and ct scan came back normal blood work and ekg was good and xray too. and both caroterys doppler was good too.
Hello.It looks like the tingling is due to the Nicotine withdrawal. You will have to wait for a few more days.Congratulations for giving up smoking.Regards

question: could it be a pinch nerve in the neck.  havent had this problem  for a few months.
title: tingling in both arms and sometimes both sides ofmy face
